imputegap.explainer package¶

Submodules¶

imputegap.explainer.explainer module¶

class imputegap.explainer.explainer.Explainer¶

Bases: object

convert_results(file, algo, descriptions, features, categories, mean_features, to_save)¶

Convert the SHAP brute result to a refined one to display in the front end :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • tmp – Current results

  • file – Dataset used

  • algo – Algorithm used

  • descriptions – Description of each feature

  • features – Raw name of each feature

  • categories – Category of each feature

  • mean_features – Mean values of each feature

:param to_save : path to save results :return: Perfect display for SHAP result

extract_features(features_categories, features_list, do_catch24=True)¶

Extract features from time series data using pycatch22. :author: Quentin Nater

:param data : time series dataset to extract features :param features_categories : way to category the features :param features_list : list of all features expected :param do_catch24 : Flag to compute the mean and standard deviation. Defaults to True.

:return : results, descriptions : dictionary of feature values by names, and array of their descriptions.

launch_shap_model(x_information, y_dataset, file, algorithm, splitter=10, display=False, verbose=False)¶

Launch the SHAP model for explaining the features of the dataset :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • x_dataset – Dataset of features extraction with descriptions

  • x_information – Descriptions of all features group by categories

  • y_dataset – Label RMSE of each series

  • file – dataset used

  • algorithm – algorithm used

  • splitter – splitter from data training and testing

  • display – display or not plots

  • verbose – display or not the prints

Returns:

results of the explainer model

load_configuration()¶

Load categories and features from a TOML file.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the TOML file.

Returns:

Two dictionaries: categories and features.

print(shap_details=None)¶

Convert the SHAP brute result to a refined one to display in the front end :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • shap_values – Values and results of the SHAP analytics

  • shap_details – Input and Ouput data of the Regression

save_assets()¶

Load path to save the assets on GitHub and local :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the TOML file.

Returns:

Two dictionaries: categories and features.

shap_explainer(algorithm='cdrec', params=None, contamination='mcar', missing_rate=0.4, block_size=10, protection=0.1, use_seed=True, seed=42, limitation=15, splitter=0, file_name='ts', display=False, verbose=False)¶

Handle parameters and set the variables to launch a model SHAP :author: Quentin Nater

Parameters:

  • dataset – imputegap dataset used for timeseries

  • algorithm – [OPTIONAL] algorithm used for imputation (“cdrec”, “stvml”, “iim”, “mrnn”) | default : cdrec

  • params – [OPTIONAL] parameters of algorithms

  • contamination – scenario used to contaminate the series | default mcar

  • missing_rate – percentage of missing values by series | default 0.2

  • block_size – size of the block to remove at each random position selected | default 10

  • protection – size in the beginning of the time series where contamination is not proceeded | default 0.1

  • use_seed – use a seed to reproduce the test | default true

  • seed – value of the seed | default 42

  • limitation – limitation of series for the model | default 15

  • splitter – limitation of training series for the model | default 3/4 of limitation

  • display – display or not the plots | default False

  • verbose – display or not the prints

Returns:

ground_truth_matrixes, obfuscated_matrixes, output_metrics, input_params, shap_values

imputegap
